trans-unit.source: Install the storage client in the mobile service project
trans-unit.target: Install the storage client in the mobile service project

trans-unit.source: To be able to generate an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library in the mobile service project.
trans-unit.target: To be able to generate an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library in the mobile service project.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the mobile service project, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the mobile service project, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, select **Stabile Only**, search for **WindowsAzure.Storage**, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, select **Stabile Only**, search for **WindowsAzure.Storage**, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the mobile service project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the mobile service project.

trans-unit.source: Update the TodoItem definition in the data model
trans-unit.target: Update the TodoItem definition in the data model

trans-unit.source: The TodoItem class defines the data object, and you need to add the same properties to this class as you did on the client.
trans-unit.target: The TodoItem class defines the data object, and you need to add the same properties to this class as you did on the client.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2013, open your mobile service project, expand the DataObjects folder, then open the TodoItem.cs project file.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2013, open your mobile service project, expand the DataObjects folder, then open the TodoItem.cs project file.

trans-unit.source: Add the following new properties to the **TodoItem** class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following new properties to the **TodoItem** class:

trans-unit.source: These properties are used to generate the SAS and to store image information.
trans-unit.target: These properties are used to generate the SAS and to store image information.

trans-unit.source: Note that the casing on these properties matches the JavaScript backend version.
trans-unit.target: Note that the casing on these properties matches the JavaScript backend version.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When using the default database initializer, Entity Framework will drop and recreate the database when it detects a data model change in the Code First definition.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When using the default database initializer, Entity Framework will drop and recreate the database when it detects a data model change in the Code First definition.

trans-unit.source: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use Code First Migrations.
trans-unit.target: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use Code First Migrations.

trans-unit.source: The default initializer cannot be used against a SQL Database in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The default initializer cannot be used against a SQL Database in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Use Code First Migrations to Update the Data Model](../articles/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-code-first-migrations.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Use Code First Migrations to Update the Data Model](../articles/mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-code-first-migrations.md).

trans-unit.source: Update the TodoItem controller to generate a shared access signature
trans-unit.target: Update the TodoItem controller to generate a shared access signature

trans-unit.source: The existing **TodoItemController** is updated so that the **PostTodoItem** method generates an SAS when a new TodoItem is inserted.
trans-unit.target: The existing **TodoItemController** is updated so that the **PostTodoItem** method generates an SAS when a new TodoItem is inserted.

trans-unit.source: You also
trans-unit.target: You also

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet created your storage account, see [How To Create a Storage Account].
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet created your storage account, see [How To Create a Storage Account].

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Storage**, click the storage account, then click **Manage Keys**.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Storage**, click the storage account, then click **Manage Keys**.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the **Storage Account Name** and **Access Key**.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the **Storage Account Name** and **Access Key**.

trans-unit.source: In your mobile service, click the **Configure** tab, scroll down to **App settings** and enter a **Name** and **Value** pair for each of the following that you obtained from the storage account, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In your mobile service, click the **Configure** tab, scroll down to **App settings** and enter a **Name** and **Value** pair for each of the following that you obtained from the storage account, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: The storage account access key is stored encrypted in app settings.
trans-unit.target: The storage account access key is stored encrypted in app settings.

trans-unit.source: You can access this key from any server script at runtime.
trans-unit.target: You can access this key from any server script at runtime.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [App settings].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [App settings].

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, open the Web.config file for the mobile service project and add the following new app settings, replacing the placeholders with the storage account name and access key that you just set in the portal:
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer in Visual Studio, open the Web.config file for the mobile service project and add the following new app settings, replacing the placeholders with the storage account name and access key that you just set in the portal:

trans-unit.source: The mobile service uses these stored settings when it runs on the local computer, which lets you test the code before you publish it.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service uses these stored settings when it runs on the local computer, which lets you test the code before you publish it.

trans-unit.source: When running in Azure, the mobile service instead uses app settings values set in the portal and ignores these project settings.
trans-unit.target: When running in Azure, the mobile service instead uses app settings values set in the portal and ignores these project settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Controllers folder, open the TodoItemController.cs file and add the following **using** directives:
trans-unit.target: In the Controllers folder, open the TodoItemController.cs file and add the following **using** directives:

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing **PostTodoItem** method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing **PostTodoItem** method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This POST method now generates a new SAS for the inserted item, which is valid for 5 minutes, and assigns the value of the generated SAS to the `sasQueryString` property of the returned item.
trans-unit.target: This POST method now generates a new SAS for the inserted item, which is valid for 5 minutes, and assigns the value of the generated SAS to the `sasQueryString` property of the returned item.

trans-unit.source: The `imageUri` property is also set to the resource path of the new BLOB to enable image display during binding in the client UI.
trans-unit.target: The `imageUri` property is also set to the resource path of the new BLOB to enable image display during binding in the client UI.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This code creates an SAS for an individual BLOB.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This code creates an SAS for an individual BLOB.

trans-unit.source: If you need to upload multiple blobs to a container using the same SAS, you can instead call the generateSharedAccessSignature method with an empty blob resource name, like this:
trans-unit.target: If you need to upload multiple blobs to a container using the same SAS, you can instead call the generateSharedAccessSignature method with an empty blob resource name, like this:

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the quickstart app to add image upload functionality by using the SAS generated on insert.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the quickstart app to add image upload functionality by using the SAS generated on insert.
